context.description: Create a Resource with Operations Create a resource under the existing resource structure with selected default operations. Existing resource paths in the API are shown in a tree structure. A new resource path can be created under the existing path structure by selecting a path container and specifying the path under the container. Use curly braces ({}) to mark a section of a URL path as replaceable using a path parameter. Select default operations to be added in the resource to be created.

context.description: Modify Resource Paths Use this dialog to modify one or more resource paths. Existing resource paths in the API are shown in a tree structure. A path segment can be modified or removed, and all of the resources with a path containing the segment are affected. New path segments can be inserted to existing paths. Use curly braces ({}) to mark a section of a URL path as replaceable using a path parameter.

context.description: Confirm Schema Type Change You are about to change the schema type of an operation request or response body. The current schema type is defined inline with the body, which is not supported by the REST API editor. With the REST API editor, you must define a model, and make the request or response body to reference the model. If you change the inlined schema type to another type, you will not be able to change the type back using the REST API editor.

context.description: REST API Wizard Use this wizard to create a REST API Project. REST API projects implement a RESTful interface. Enter a name for the REST API project. When creating a REST API from scratch, the REST API project name will also be the name of the REST API. When importing a Swagger document, the name of the REST API is in the Swagger. The REST API name, base path and version can be edited after the REST API is created.
